messageBody:
Dear Anthony,

There is no easy replacement for getName(). I too often miss that convenient
object encapsulating the test fixture and the specification of the test to
be run. What would constitute a good solution depends on what problem you
are solving with the name. Can you say a little more about this?

Regards,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
MULLER Anthony
Sent: Wednesday, March 26, 2008 5:34 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: JUnit 3 - compatibility - getName() method



I talk about this method:
http://junit.
<http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc/junit/framework/TestCase.html#getName>
sourceforge.net/javadoc/junit/framework/TestCase.html#getName()

The getName() method is specific to JUnit 3, it doesn't appear on
Object class:
http://java. <http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/Object.html>
sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/Object.html

As I said, with JUnit4 you don't need to inherit any class... So how
to replace a call to getName() method?

Regards,
Anthony
